newsitem.title: USA: Americans vote Australia number one holiday place.
newsitem.headline: Americans vote Australia number one holiday place.

text.p: If Americans could spend a vacation in any other country in the world and cost was not an issue, their clear favorite would be Australia, according to a poll released on Sunday.
Britain was their second choice and France their third in the survey conducted by Louis Harris and Associates, Inc.
But Australia came in number one on the list of preferred travel destinations among almost all demographic groups -- men, women, most age groups and regions.
Britain and Italy were the first and second choices among people 65 and over, while African-Americans' first preference was France.
Next in order of overall popularity after Australia, Britain and France came Germany, Italy, Canada, Ireland, Mexico, Switzerland and Israel.

The pollsters attributed the popularity of Australia as a travel destination to the marketing efforts of its tourist authorities as well as the appeal of the outback, the Great Barrier Reef, Australian movies and the friendly, outgoing, English-speaking people.
The survey was conducted by telephone within the United States between June 11-17 among a nationwide cross section of 1,026 adults and has a margin of error of plus or minus three percentage points.
